node.title: Mystery surrounds kangaroo that got stuck on a hot tin roof in Mount Isa
node.description: Firefighters in the north-west Queensland town say they are used to rescuing cats,Â dogs and birds, but finding a kangaroo on the roof on a house is a first.
node.content:
["Residents in the north-west Queensland town of Mount Isa have been left scratching their heads after finding a kangaroo on the roof of a house on Monday evening.", "Local kids spotted the kangaroo\u00a0atop a\u00a0home on\u00a0Duchess Road and called in emergency services, who had to be convinced it was a genuine call.", "\"We thought it was a hoax when we got the call but sure enough, when we showed up, there it was on the roof,\" said Patrick Buck, a senior firefighter at Queensland Fire and Emergency Services.", "\"We went up with all our harnesses and rescue equipment, but as soon as we got there he went off the end of the roof and jumped down into some shrubs,\" he said.", "\"We can add this to the list of rescuing dogs, cats, birds \u2014 and now a roo off a roof.", "", "
Firefighters needed to be convinced the call was genuine.(Supplied: Paula Boon)
", "Witness and manager of the local animal rescue Paws Hoofs and Claws, Sue Carson said the kangaroo\u00a0created quite the spectacle.", "", "
Members of the local fire brigade who helped coax the roo down.(Supplied: Paula Boon)
", "\"The firies were great. A young fella got on the harness and climbed up there and walked slowly toward the roo to try and get it to jump off the back of the house where the drop was a lot safer.", "\"It's a unique situation and one we've never dealt with before.", "\"It ended up bounding off into the bushes so it was a happy ending to a funny story.\""]
